content: On September 3, 1993, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the San Diego Padres in a thrilling game that showcased the brilliance of pitcher Greg Maddux. Maddux threw a complete game, allowing just one run and striking out 11 batters, leading the Braves to a 5-1 victory. This performance was part of Maddux's incredible season, where he would ultimately win the Cy Young Award, solidifying his status as one of the game's greats.
